parameters.content: # n8n Subworkflow Dependency Graph & Auto-Tagging

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content: The script builds a dependency graph of workflows by identifying which workflows call others (via execution nodes) while preserving workflow names, caller relationships, and tags.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content: Here we filter out any workflows that are not [sub-workflows]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} (i.e. executed by other workflows).

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content: We verify that the sub-workflows we intend to tag exist in our instance (not old workflow ids left over after importing a workflow from another instance)

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content: If a tag is freshly created during an earlier iteration through the list of workflows, then it is removed from the list of new callers (i.e. new tags to create).

### Pie Chart
Basic visualization of which sub-workflows are called most often by other workflows

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note8

parameters.content:
## Setup instructions:
1. [Set n8n API credentials]({{ $env.API_BASE_URL }}
2. Replace instance_url in workflow (highlighted in red)

## Frequently used terms
1. **Callers**: Workflows that execute or trigger another workflow (a subworkflow) within n8n. They often use the Execute Workflow node to pass data and control execution flow.
2. **Sub-workflow**: A sub-workflow is any workflow that is executed by another workflow. These are often used for reusable automation logic, breaking down complex workflows into modular components.
3. **Dependency Graph**: A dependency graph visually represents the relationships between workflows in an n8n instance. It maps out which workflows call others, helping users understand execution dependencies, optimize workflow organization, and prevent unintended changes that may break subworkflows.

nodes.name: Sticky Note11

parameters.content:
## About this workflow
This workflow analyzes an n8n instance to detect dependencies between workflows. It identifies which workflows call others ([sub-workflows]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }} builds a dependency graph, and automatically tags subworkflows with their calling workflows. This makes it easier to track dependencies, optimize workflow structures, and maintain documentation in complex n8n environments.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# n8n Subworkflow Dependency Graph & Auto-Tagging

## Overview
Automated workflow: n8n Subworkflow Dependency Graph & Auto-Tagging. This workflow integrates 17 different services: webhook, filter, httpRequest, stickyNote, code. It contains 52 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 52
- **Node Types**: 17
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Update workflow tags**: httpRequest
- **GET all workflows**: n8n
- **List callers of subworkflows**: code
- **Exclude uncalled workflows**: filter
- **Exclude missing workflows**: filter
- **And every Sunday**: scheduleTrigger
- **When this workflow is activated**: n8nTrigger
- **GET workflow(s)**: n8n
- **Count callers and identify new callers**: set
- **Loop through workflows**: splitInBatches
- ... and 42 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
